summary: The Care Across Generations Act (H.R. 1812) proposes to amend the Older Americans Act of 1965 to establish a competitive grant program. This program will fund multigenerational activities in long-term care facilities, including operating or contracting with qualified child care facilities, coordinating activities between child care and care facilities, and expanding or building long-term care facilities. Eligible entities will be required to evaluate the effectiveness of the programs and report findings. The Assistant Secretary will provide a report to Congress regarding the grants. Guidelines are set for applying and grant periods. Infection control measures for visitors are also mandated.
